title: Plastic & Film
description: SRP fabricates custom plastic and film gaskets, seals, and insulators for a wide variety of industries and applications.

seo.title: Plastic & Film
seo.description: SRP fabricates custom plastic and film gaskets, seals, and insulators for a wide variety of industries and applications.

content: SRP Converts A Variety Of Thin Plastic And Film Products to your custom requirements.SRP has the capabilities to convert custom plastic and film into gaskets, seals, and insulators for a variety of industries and applications.Plastic and film materials generally have good aging properties and will not deteriorate over time. These materials are strong and flexible having a high tensile strength, flexibility, durability and dimensional stability. Premium plastics and film products have low shrinkage, low moisture absorption, good dielectric properties and high thermal resistance.SRP typically converts plastic and film materials ranging from .001” to .125” thick. However, when utilizing our waterjet, we can cut plastic up to .250” thick and maintaining tight tolerances.Plastic and film materials are cut per our customers specifications, and can be supplied with a pressure sensitive adhesive.Common Plastic MaterialsFormex™ PolypropylenePOREX® PTFETeflon® PTFEPolyethylene (PET)Common Film MaterialsKapton® PolyimideMelinex® Polyester (PET)Mylar® Polyester (PET)Lexan™ PolycarbonateValox™ PolybutyleneRigid Vinyl PVC (Polyvinyl Chloride)  SRP: Building Relationships through Converting Solutions Since 1951We provide our customers with everything from material sampling and product prototyping to full manufacturing, packaging, and delivery. We provide value to our customers by delivering exceptional customer service, engineering solutions, and quality products to meet their every need.

title: Pressure Sensitive Adhesive
description: SRP provides adhesive laminating services for adhesive backed products that can be converted into custom gaskets and seals.

seo.title: Pressure Sensitive Adhesive
seo.description: SRP provides adhesive laminating services for adhesive backed products that can be converted into custom gaskets and seals.

content: Pressure Sensitive Adhesive Backing Can be Applied To Most substrates and Converted Into Custom Gaskets, Seals, Pads and MoreIf your product requires a Pressure Sensitive Adhesive backing, SRP can laminate the raw materials before it is converted to the finished part. Our top of the line custom laminating system is the best in the industry. The majority of the products we make are custom fabricated with adhesive lamination one one or both sides of the substrate. There are three primary adhesive groups: Silicone, Acrylic, and Rubber based.Foam Tapes are available in a variety of thicknesses, adhesives, carriers and sizes. Custom Foam tapes are designed to enhance the appearance and improve the overall performance of your product design. The benefits of using Custom Foam Tape include: Sealing, Cushioning, Vibration Damping, Impact Resistance, and withstands wide temperature ranges to bond to rough or irregular surfaces in permanent or repositionable applications.We work directly with adhesive companies such as 3M, Avery, CCT, MacTac and Adchem. We have created fabulous relationships with our adhesive suppliers. This allows us to work closely with them to be able to choose the optimum solution for our customers. Our engineers will work with you to determine the best fit adhesive to your application. SRP: Building Relationships through Converting Solutions Since 1951We provide our customers with everything from material sampling and product prototyping to full manufacturing, packaging, and delivery. We provide value to our customers by delivering exceptional customer service, engineering solutions, and quality products to meet their every need.For more information, you can reach SRP at info@srpco.com or 847-593-5630.

title: 3M Adhesives & Tapes
description: SRP is a 3M Preferred Converter for their line of pressure sensitive adhesives in the 3M converter market product line.

seo.title: 3M Adhesives & Tapes
seo.description: SRP is a 3M Preferred Converter for their line of pressure sensitive adhesives in the 3M converter market product line.

content: SRP combines 3M Adhesives with various elastomeric substrates and converts them to your custom gasket and seal requirements. .fullframe {    height: 500px;    padding-bottom: 86px;}From repositionable to permanent, 3M adhesive tape can be readily matched to the substrate and stress characteristics needed in the joint. Our custom fabricated 3M adhesives and tapes products can provide many solutions to countless applications using an array of different types of materials. Some of these solutions and benefits are listed below.Replace Mechanical FastenersSpeed up your overall assembly process and improve product aesthetics and strength by replacing mechanical fasteners with 3M Adhesive Tape. Unlike screws and rivets, custom 3M Adhesive Tapes distribute stress evenly over the entire bonded area. With uniform stress distribution of adhesives and tapes, lighter and thinner materials can be used without having to worry about distortion, splitting, or crazing. This also reduces the chance for rust, corrosion, and water penetration. 3M Adhesives Tapes dampen vibration while imparting flexibility to a joint or bonded area for the ultimate hold.Join Dissimilar MaterialsEnhance the performance of hard-to-bond surfaces and solve the adhesion challenges of dissimilar materials with 3M Adhesive Tapes and 3M Double Sided Adhesive Tapes. These materials bond to a wide range of substrates from metals, wood, glass, plastics and ceramics. This includes “hard to bond,” low surface energy materials.Increase Speed and Productivity Improve aesthetics and performance while boosting overall speed and productivity with 3M adhesives and tapes. Reduce process steps such as weld grinding and sealing individual penetrations from screws, nuts and bolts. Many tape and adhesive technologies require little operator training, reducing labor costs.Improve appearance and aesthetics3M adhesive tape is generally hidden between the bonded substrates, offering nearly invisible fastening. Surfaces stay smooth and clean for a more attractive appearance and less surface refinishing. Why Choose SRP For Custom 3M Adhesive Tape Products?SRP has been a Preferred Converter of 3M products for over 25 years. We provide our customers with everything from material sampling and product prototyping to full manufacturing, packaging, and delivery. We provide value to our customers by delivering exceptional customer service, engineering solutions, and quality products to meet their every need.

title: Rogers PORON Polyurethane Foam
description: SRP is a Preferred Converter for Rogers Corporations. We fabricate PORON Polyurethane materials into custom gaskets, seals, and pads.

seo.title: Rogers PORON Polyurethane Foam
seo.description: SRP is a Preferred Converter for Rogers Corporations. We fabricate PORON Polyurethane materials into custom gaskets, seals, and pads.

content: SRP converts PORON Polyurethane Foam materials to your custom gasket and seal requirements, and can be supplied with a pressure sensitive adhesive. PORON Polyurethane Foams offer the following benefits:Excellent compression set resistance, which enables durable, long-term performance for gasketing, sealing, and cushioning.Low-outgassing and non-fogging, containing no plasticizers or residual chemicals to contaminate the device. The material will not become brittle and crumble and is non-corrosive to metal.Inherently flame retardant without the use of additives. Many of the materials meet flammability requirements of UL HBF and MVSS 302.Engineered urethane formulations offering a wide modulus range – 2-90 psi @ 25% deflection – for more design versatility requirements.Good chemical resistanceEasy to fabricate, die-cuts cleanly and works with a broad range of adhesivesBroad range of formulas and thicknesses from 0.012″ to 0.500″ (0.43mm to 12.7mm)Why Choose SRP for Custom Rogers PORON Polyurethane products?Since 1951, SRP has served a number of industries. We supply gaskets, heat shields, insulators, isolators, and other related products to electronics, defense, energy, medical, transportation, microelectronics, and other industries. In addition to Rogers PORON® microcellular polyurethanes, we also supply Rogers BISCO silicones. Both materials can be laminated with pressure sensitive adhesive for custom gasketing and sealing options for a wide array of industries. SRP is also a Preferred Converter for Rogers’s materials. Do you have questions about PORON Polyurethane? Feel free to contact us.

title: Rogers BISCO Silicone
description: SRP is a Preferred Converter for Rogers Corporation. We fabricate BISCO silicone materials into custom gaskets, heat shields, and seals.

seo.title: Rogers BISCO Silicone
seo.description: SRP is a Preferred Converter for Rogers Corporation. We fabricate BISCO silicone materials into custom gaskets, heat shields, and seals.

content: Custom Rogers BISCO Silicone Gaskets and Seals For Superior Performance.fullframe {    height: 500px;    padding-bottom: 86px;}Full Line of Cellular, Solid and Specialty BISCO Materials, produced in roll stock to be fabricated into:GasketsHeat shieldsFire stopsSealsCushionsInsulation for a wide variety of applicationsBISCO Silicone Foams For Superior PerformanceResistant to temperature extremesResistant to UVResistant to ozoneExtremely resilient to mechanical fatigueExcellent compression-set and creep resistanceMeets the most stringent UL flame ratingsBISCO Products Offer Exceptional Heat Insulating PropertiesEnormously versatile and always in demand, Rogers’ collection of silicone materials has been specifically developed for use in a wide range of heat shielding and insulating applications. Silicone materials are well known as thermal and electrical insulators as well as useful for gasketing, cushioning, and sealing. We stock a variety of silicone products that can be used for a variety of applications.BISCO Silicone Solutions for a Range of Production ChallengeFrom ultra soft silicone foam, which allows designers to use less force to seal enclosures and still protect their device from the environment, to extra firm silicone that offers excellent memory and low stress relaxation, which reduces maintenance costs associated with gasket failures due to compression set and softening.BISCO For a Variety of IndustriesOur customers include companies involved in the automotive, safety and security, HVAC, and aerospace industries, as well as a number of other industries that require the dependability and exceptional performance BISCO products can bring. Competitively priced and formulated to comply with a range of national and international legislation, we offer a premium solution that can be easily adapted to your specific requirements.SRP: A Rogers Corporation Preferred ConverterSRP is proud to be a Rogers Corporation Preferred Converter for their line of PORON Polyurethane and BISCO Silicone materials. We provide distribution and converting of these materials to various industries and customers around the world. Being a Preferred Converter for Rogers provides us access to all Rogers materials, with the added benefit of discounts and favorable lead times. SRP converts these materials into custom gaskets, seals, pads and stripping. All products can be laminated with a pressure sensitive adhesive.

title: Sheet Rubber
description: SRP converts a variety of sheet rubber materials such as Neoprene, EPDM, Silicone and Nitrile into custom gaskets, seals and pads.

seo.title: Sheet Rubber
seo.description: SRP converts a variety of sheet rubber materials such as Neoprene, EPDM, Silicone and Nitrile into custom gaskets, seals and pads.

content: EPDM, Nitrile, Silicone, Neoprene and more, Custom Converted To Your SpecificationsSheet Rubber materials are used for Gasketing, Cushioning, Sealing, Sound Damping and many other applications. From applications requiring resistance to oil and solvents, abrasion and flex cracking, ozone and sunlight, heat, water, and steam, to products that require excellent tear strength, vibration damping, temperature specifications, and compression set. SRP most certainly has the right type of sheet rubber to fit your application. Using our advanced laminating system, Pressure Sensitive Adhesive can be applied to all materials.SRP stocks many of the sheet rubber materials in a variety thicknesses and durometers. We will work with your team to ensure you are choosing the right material for your specific application. If you require any material sampling, or prototyping services for testing in your application, we will work hard with your team to get you what you need in a timely fashion. We base our success on the quality of the product and the customer service we bring to the table.Sheet Rubber Materials Commonly Converted at SRPNeopreneSiliconeNitrile (Buna-N)EPDMButylNorseal® SiliconeSBRThermoplastic ElastomerNatural RubberFluoroelastomerCloth-Inserted SRP: Building Relationships through Converting Solutions Since 1951We provide our customers with everything from material sampling and product prototyping to full manufacturing, packaging, and delivery. We provide value to our customers by delivering exceptional customer service, engineering solutions, and quality products to meet their every need.

title: Foam
description: SRP has been providing custom converted foam gaskets and seals to various industries since 1951. We exceed customer expectations through exceptional customer service, quality manufacturing, competitive pricing and on-time delivery.

seo.title: Foam
seo.description: SRP has been providing custom converted foam gaskets and seals to various industries since 1951. We exceed customer expectations through exceptional customer service, quality manufacturing, competitive pricing and on-time delivery.

content: SRP has been providing custom converted foam gaskets and seals to various industries since 1951. We exceed customer expectations through exceptional customer service, quality manufacturing, competitive pricing and on-time delivery.

blocks.title: Foam gasket features
blocks.content:
• Quality raw foam materials
  • Easy to die-cut, fabricate
  • Closed cell structure
  • Compression set resistance
  • Available in various thicknesses and densities
  • Can be supplied adhesive backed

blocks.title: Benefits
blocks.content:
• Good impact & vibration absorption
  • Chemical resistance & mild oil resistance
  • Good acoustic & thermal insulation properties
  • Low water absorption
  • Wide operating temperature range

blocks.title: Common materials for Custom foam gaskets
blocks.content:
• Ensolite Closed Cell Foam
  • HyPUR-cel Polyurethane Foam
  • Norseal Silicone
  • PORON 4701-40 Polyurethane
  • PORON 4790-92 Polyurethane
  • BISCO BF-1000 Silicone Foam
  • BISCO HT-820 Silicone Foam

blocks.title: Applications
blocks.content:
• Battery Pads & Cushions
  • Cushioning
  • EMI Shielding
  • Flame Barrier
  • Gap Filling
  • Gasketing & Sealing
  • LED Lighting
  • Shock Absorption & Vibration Control
  • Gaskets & Seals
  • Display Protection
  • Battery Pads
  • Shock Absorption
  • Vibration Control
  • Gap Filling
  • Electrical Enclosures
  • Sound Blocking and Absorption

title: Silicone

seo.title: Silicone
seo.description: SRP has been providing custom converted silicone gaskets and seals to various industries since 1951. We exceed customer expectations through exceptional customer service, quality manufacturing, competitive pricing and on-time delivery.

content: SRP has been providing custom converted silicone gaskets and seals to various industries since 1951. We exceed customer expectations through exceptional customer service, quality manufacturing, competitive pricing and on-time delivery.Silicone is a high-performance elastomer with exceptional properties that make this an ideal material for a high performance applications.

blocks.title: Features
blocks.content:
• Easy to die-cut, fabricate
  • Can be supplied adhesive backed
  • Available in a variety of silicone formulations
  • Available in a variety of densities
  • Available in a variety of thicknesses
  • Superior performance capabilities
  • Used for a variety of applications

blocks.title: Why Silicone Gaskets?
blocks.content:
• Resistant to temperature extremes
  • Resistant to UV
  • Resistant to ozone
  • Extremely resilient to mechanical fatigue
  • Excellent compression-set and creep resistance
  • Meets the most stringent UL flame ratings

blocks.title: silicone gaskets can be fabricated from the following materials:
blocks.content:
• BISCO BF-1000 Silicone Foam
  • BISCO HT-800 Silicone Foam
  • BISCO HT-820 Silicone Foam
  • BISCO HT-840 Silicone Foam
  • BISCO HT-870 Silicone Foam
  • SSP EMI / RFI Conductive Silicones
  • Norseal Silicone

blocks.title: Applications
blocks.content:
• Gasketing & Sealing
  • Cushioning
  • Battery Pads & Cushions
  • Gap Filling
  • LED Lighting
  • Shock Absorption & Vibration Control
